name: a(n) is the number of primes less than 4^(n^2).
comment: Thue's proof, that there exist infinitely many primes, shows also that n+1 is a lower bound for a(n) (see Ribenboim, 2004).
reference: Paulo Ribenboim, The Little Book of Bigger Primes, Springer-Verlag NY 2004. See pp. 9-10.
program: def A382481(n): return primepi(1<<(n**2<<1)) # _Chai Wah Wu_, Mar 29 2025
author: _Stefano Spezia_, Mar 28 2025
